name: Manchester
story: Manchester's industrial heritage meets modern coffee culture, with converted warehouses housing some of the North's finest roasters.

name: Istanbul
story: Where East meets West, Istanbul's coffee culture bridges centuries-old Turkish traditions with modern specialty coffee innovations.
headline: this is the sample headline

name: Almaty
story: In a region starved of competition, Almaty comfortably takes the title of Central Asia's best coffee city. Expect an impressive selection of contemporary, well-designed shops scattered across the city, with particular concentration around Abay Avenue.

name: Bishkek
story: Frequently perceived to be ten years behind Almaty on the development curve, Bishkek's nascent speciality coffee scene confirms this assessment. Only a handful of options exist across the city.

name: Tunis
story: Whilst Tunisians have an insatiable appetite for coffee, generally served black in one of the nation's thousands of small, smoke-filled caf√©s, speciality coffee has failed to materialise in any meaningful capacity.

name: Tangier
story: Like most Moroccan cities, contemporary coffee shops are scarce. Tangier, however, has one excellent option

name: Marrakesh
story: Marrakesh boasts Morocco's most developed speciality coffee scene, with a couple of high-quality establishments serving the city's considerable tourist population.

name: Casablanca
story: Casablanca offers very little when it comes to standout coffee destinations, mirroring the city's broader lack of appeal. Disappointing for Morocco's largest metropolis and commercial centre.

name: Tashkent
story: For a city of its size and stature, there is disappointingly little evidence of a speciality coffee scene. Bitterly disappointing for a city of over 2.5 million residents.

name: Hua Hin
story:
Situated around three hours south of Bangkok on the Gulf coast, the seaside town of Hua Hin continues to affirm Thailand's reputation for exceptional coffee. Whilst you won't find the breadth and depth of options available in Chiang Mai, or the plush, ultra-modern aesthetic of Bangkok's specialty scene, there's no shortage of small independent roastery-caf√©s worth seeking out.

As with the rest of the country, expect light-roasted domestic single origins alongside an impressive range of imported beans, with prices noticeably gentler than in the capital.
headline: Royal seaside resort town with coffee culture

name: Izmir
story: This coastal city's relaxed Mediterranean atmosphere perfectly complements its emerging specialty coffee scene.

name: Ankara
story: Turkey's capital city balances government formality with a growing appreciation for artisanal coffee and modern caf√© culture.

name: London
story: London's coffee scene is a melting pot of international influences, from traditional Italian espresso bars to Nordic-style light roasts.
